text: Hello everyone, don’t know if this is the right place to ask but here goes. I am working on a HubSpot app and have a CORS issue on the redirect authorization url when going through the frontend.  The project structure is NextJs on the frontend and NestJs on the backend. If I simply use the api url the flow works fine, but if I try from the frontend I get the CORS error on the authorization url. Any other api calls work fine after I manually do the oauth flow. Any thoughts ? Didn’t find anything online that could help, also the implementation is similar to the sample-oauth project from the HubSpot github.

Hello,

I am trying to fetch deal owner name in a custom code, but the code is always returning the owner ID instead.
What is the workaround to get the full name of the owner? When i try to get the full name it is returning undefined.

Thanks!
You'll have to use that id to then ping the owners api
You could also create a static array of all the owners and their details but that would fail fast if you add more people to your team

Hi! I'm trying to load a vendor script (npm, instasearch.js) which includes "{{" in the source code of one of its dependencies.

What happens is that HubSpot thinks this is HubL and tries to remove it, making the whole package unusable.. How can this be a feature? Any tips?
